p: Typically LB compatible materials are amphiphilic molecules having two distinct regions, which are a hydrophilic head group (water loving) and a hydrophobic tail group (water hating) as shown in Fig.Â 1a. They must be soluble in organic non polar and water immiscible solvents. Water insoluble amphiphilic molecules form floating monolayer at air-water interface. Long chain fatty acid, lipid molecules etc are the example of LB compatible materials.
